comments:
Hi, 
I'm starting to feel bad about all the bugs I'm reporting, yet I hope you see it as a contribution to make 
this platform even better!
First of all, my config:
OS X.3.7 (aka Panther)
Eclipse 3.1 M4
Webtools M2

The symptoms: several bugs happen using the snippets view. 
Like: 
- after adding one, I had no right scrollbar 
- (minor issue) the Mac shortcuts were not working (like command + --> to go to the end of the line)
- (big issue) it crashed when I tried to add one. I copy pasted some HTML and it gave me 2 errors: on 
einfinite loop error from org.eclipse.ui (lost trace as final crash) and while this happened a second one 
(JVM error) closing my workbench (no options left) The first error was a "Unhandled event loop 
exception" & "An exception stack trace could not be found."
- strangely enough, after restarting it, I noticed the snippet was there, and also the categories I made. 
- another bug I got was: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
Full stack: 
------

Hope you guys can solve some of these issues for the next Milestone. 
Thanks already. 

Philippe

& Smth else I just noticed additionally: after editing a snippet, its decription (title) is not shown.

Reassinging to gef to comment on the stack traces.

For some reason on the Mac, the AWT system lib cannot be started from SWT 
thread. Our Bidi class is trying to use the AWT Bidi support, and this fails on 
the Mac only.

I suspect this stack trace is coming from the runtime VM and not from Eclipse, 
which has the other bugs (scrollbars, accelerators stop working, etc.)
This doesn't belong to JDT/UI. Moving to GEF.

Please open individual bugs for each problem. We appreciate the help in finding 
problem with Eclipse. Please be as specific as possible and try to understand 
the problem as much as you can.

Stack traces shouldn't get lost.  They are written to a ".log" file in the 
workspace .metadata folder.
